messages.title: Say NO to politics as usual
messages.content: The opportunity to stand as an MP is humbling as it is a service to my community. It is a community that has given me opportunities and support and I would be proud to be your Green Party representative and spread the message to make sure people know, a better world is possible.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Greens know our security & environment are interconnected. Let's end battles over oil & resources & protect against climate change.
Push for procurement of local land for community resources like youth services or allotments.
Restore Youth Services: so people can learn skills, be creative, live positive social lives & help avoid crime & violence.
In 2015, 1 Million votes = 1 Green MP. If we had a fairer system, you would have 30 Green MPs fighting for you & the environment.

issues.environment: Greens know our security & environment are interconnected. Let's end battles over oil & resources & protect against climate change.

housing.content: Push for procurement of local land for community resources like youth services or allotments.

leaflet.personalStatement: I am a life long Brent resident, conceived in Harlesden, born in Kilburn, grew up in Queens Park and now reside in Willesden. I wasn't always political but like many, after the Iraq war I was left with so many questions about politics in the UK. Questions like, what makes democracy work for the people, not just the powerful? I am passionate about community, the environment, equality, the NHS, animals and education. I often feel so inspired by what could be possible, how the country can be transformed for the good of all, not just the few. I see a country where we have clean air, renewable energy, we look after our environment, we care for the vulnerable, have meaningful and secure work and where everyone gets the opportunity to thrive and fulfil their potential. I know this is possible but I also know it can only be achieved together.
